Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Brassicaceae

source.author: Entwisle, T.J.
source.title: Brassicaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae
source.citation: Modified from: Entwisle, T.J. (1996). Brassicaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 3. Dicotyledons Winteraceae to Myrtaceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Upper stem leaves simple or with 1 (rarely more) pair(s) of lateral lobes; ripening fruits typically crowded and strongly ascending; seed narrowly winged; robust, often slightly fleshy native species of alpine and subalpine areas, generally rare, but locally common post-fire
Upper stem leaves with 2 or more pairs of lateral lobes; ripening fruits scattered to moderately crowded, spreading to ascending; seed unwinged; weeds, mainly of agricultural land
Basal leaves with 2–5 pairs of lateral lobes; fruit 3.5 cm or less long
Basal leaves with 5–10 pairs of lateral lobes; fruit 3 cm or more long
